title: mytri: Delaunay Triangulation Made Simple
text: mytri R package demonstrates simple method connecting five 2D points three triangles. approach forms foundation exploring advanced Delaunay triangulation techniques R.

title: mytri: Delaunay Triangulation Made Simple
text: Triangulation Function: Implements connect_five_points takes 5×2 matrix points returns points along edges forming three triangles. Sample Data: Provides built-dataset sample_points five 2D coordinates. Graphical Output: Offers code visualize triangulation using ggplot2.

title: mytri: Delaunay Triangulation Made Simple
code: # Load the built-in sample data data("sample_points")  # Calculate the triangulation using the built-in data result <- mytri::connect_five_points(sample_points) print(result) # Example custom input: a 5x2 matrix of points custom_points <- matrix(c(1, 2, 2, 4, 4, 5, 5, 1, 3, 9), ncol = 2, byrow = TRUE) result <- mytri::connect_five_points(custom_points) print(result) $points      [,1] [,2] [1,]    1    2 [2,]    2    4 [3,]    4    5 [4,]    5    1 [5,]    3    9  $edges       [,1] [,2]  [1,]    1    2  [2,]    2    3  [3,]    3    1  [4,]    2    3  [5,]    3    4  [6,]    4    2  [7,]    3    4  [8,]    4    5  [9,]    5    3
